oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Charge injection using gate-induced-drain-leakage current for characterization of plasma edge damage in CMOS devices
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BROZEK, T
RAMGOPAL RAO, V
SRIDHARAN, A
WERKING, JD
CHAN, YD
VISWANATHAN, CR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cmos integrated circuit
electric charge
integrated circuit measurement
integrated circuit reliability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, we describe the application of gate-induced-drain-leakage (GIDL) current for the characterization of gate edge damage which occurs during the plasma etch processes. We show from experimental and simulation results that when the channel is biased in accumulation and with the drain-substrate junction reverse biased, charge injection is localized in the gate-drain overlap region. Under this localized charge injection (LCI) mode of operation, the gate voltage is a function of edge oxide thickness which in turn can be related to the plasma damage received during the poly-etch and subsequent spacer oxide formation. The detailed mechanism of localized charge injection for a study of plasma edge damage is explained along with the experimental demonstration of this technique using submicron MOSFET's.
